S3Config.description:
S3-specific config params.
Inherit your config class from this class if you need
to talk to an S3 service in the backend.

Args:
    s3_endpoint_url (str): The URL to the S3 endpoint.
    s3_access_key_id (str):
        Part of credentials for login into the S3 service. See:
        https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html
    s3_secret_access_key (str):
        Part of credentials for login into the S3 service. See:
        https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html
    s3_session_token (Optional[str]):
        Optional part of credentials for login into the S3 service. See:
        https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html
    aws_config_ini (Optional[Path]):
        Path to a config file for specifying more advanced S3 parameters.
        This should follow the format described here:
        https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/configuration.html#using-a-configuration-file
        Defaults to None.

s3_access_key_id.description: Part of credentials for login into the S3 service. See: https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html
s3_access_key_id.title: S3 Access Key Id

s3_secret_access_key.description: Part of credentials for login into the S3 service. See: https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html
s3_secret_access_key.title: S3 Secret Access Key

s3_session_token.description: Part of credentials for login into the S3 service. See: https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html
s3_session_token.title: S3 Session Token

aws_config_ini.description: Path to a config file for specifying more advanced S3 parameters. This should follow the format described here: https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/configuration.html#using-a-configuration-file
aws_config_ini.title: Aws Config Ini

S3Config.title: S3Config

S3ObjectStorageNodeConfig.description:
Configuration for one specific object storage node and one bucket in it.

The bucket is the main bucket that the service is responsible for.
S3ObjectStorageNodeConfig.title: S3ObjectStorageNodeConfig

description: Modifies the orginal Settings class provided by the user

interrogation_topic.description: Name of the topic used for events informing about the outcome of file validations.
interrogation_topic.title: Interrogation Topic

interrogation_success_type.description: The type used for events informing about the success of a file validation.
interrogation_success_type.title: Interrogation Success Type

interrogation_failure_type.description: The type used for events informing about the failure of a file validation.
interrogation_failure_type.title: Interrogation Failure Type

upload_received_event_topic.description: Name of the topic to publish events that inform about new file uploads.
upload_received_event_topic.title: Upload Received Event Topic

upload_received_event_type.description: The type to use for events that inform about new file uploads.
upload_received_event_type.title: Upload Received Event Type

service_instance_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies this instance across all instances of this service. A globally unique Kafka client ID will be created by concatenating the service_name and the service_instance_id.
service_instance_id.title: Service Instance Id

kafka_servers.description: A list of connection strings to connect to Kafka bootstrap servers.
kafka_servers.title: Kafka Servers

kafka_security_protocol.description: Protocol used to communicate with brokers. Valid values are: PLAINTEXT, SSL.
kafka_security_protocol.title: Kafka Security Protocol

kafka_ssl_cafile.description: Certificate Authority file path containing certificates used to sign broker certificates. If a CA is not specified, the default system CA will be used if found by OpenSSL.
kafka_ssl_cafile.title: Kafka Ssl Cafile

kafka_ssl_certfile.description: Optional filename of client certificate, as well as any CA certificates needed to establish the certificate's authenticity.
kafka_ssl_certfile.title: Kafka Ssl Certfile

kafka_ssl_keyfile.description: Optional filename containing the client private key.
kafka_ssl_keyfile.title: Kafka Ssl Keyfile

kafka_ssl_password.description: Optional password to be used for the client private key.
kafka_ssl_password.title: Kafka Ssl Password

generate_correlation_id.description: A flag, which, if False, will result in an error when trying to publish an event without a valid correlation ID set for the context. If True, the a newly correlation ID will be generated and used in the event header.
generate_correlation_id.title: Generate Correlation Id

ekss_base_url.description: URL pointing to the Encryption Key Store service.
ekss_base_url.title: Ekss Base Url

title: ModSettings
